Package gui.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
gui.controller.GameController
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
This class implements a timer that enables the player to move around, counts the days and makes the fields grow with timer. To move around it proofs, if right, left, up or down is pressed and as long one of these directions is pressed the moving object moves around. The pressed booleans are set in the gameScene.
Author:
Judith

    • initGameLoop

      public void initGameLoop​(GameScene gameScene, FieldTile fieldTile, GameValue gameValue, MovingObjectController movingObjectController)
      This method implements the timer and with every 100 milliseconds it calls the methods moveObject(), proofAction(), and proofFieldAction() from the class movingObjectController. It also calls the methods dayCounter, that increases the day, and proofFieldCounter() that makes the fields grow.
      Parameters:
      gameScene - the gameScene object of the actual game
      fieldTile - the fieldTile object of the actual game
      gameValue - the gameValue object of the actual game
      movingObjectController - the movingObjectController of the actual game

    • dayCounter

      private void dayCounter​(GameValue gameValue)
      Everytime this method is called it increments the int dayCounter and if dayCounter reaches 100 it increases the day.
      Parameters:
      gameValue - the gameValue object of the actual game

    • proofFieldCounter

      private void proofFieldCounter​(GameScene gameScene, FieldTile fieldTile)
      This method proofs, if the state of growth of all three fields. If it is bigger than one it starts a counter and every time the method is called it increments it. If the counter reaches 500 it
      Parameters:
      gameScene - the gameScene object of the actual game
      fieldTile - the fieldTile object of the actual game
